elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
(FX: END OF SPACE BATTLE: LASER CANNON FIRE, A FLAMING SHIP
RECEDING)
FX: CLUNKY-SOUNDING SONTARAN TECH
A glorious sight, is it not? The Jalanx flagship aflame as it falls into the Doghead Nebula. Hold fire, Sergeant Gredd.
FX: CANNON FIRE STOPS
See how their star-pods flounder without a leader. Like limbs on a body when you’ve removed the head.
(GRUNTING LAUGH) Aye, Marshal. I remember that Velosian commandant.

The Jalanx have learned their lesson here, just as the Velosians did on the Ninth Moon. Yet another Rutan ally discovers its folly. All those who stand against the Empire will feel the sting of the Six-Twentieth Attack Fleet.
(FX: COMMS ALERT) Major Vlaar? Report.
(D — VIA COMMS) Six gravity spheres remain, Marshal Stenn.
Captain Trab and Sergeant Klor died as warriors.
Yes. I saw.
(D) Permission to pick off the remaining Jalanx, sir?
Granted, Major. You’ve earned it.
FX: URGENT ALARM
What’s that?
Urgent transmission from Sontar Command. New orders, Marshal.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 2
Go ahead, Sergeant.
FX: CLUNKY DATA PRINTOUT
We are to move to these co-ordinates and await further instruction.
(TAKING PRINTOUT) I see. We are the nearest available company... Hmmm. Sergeant Gredd. Signal the capsules. Have them return to the Command Ship. Once they’ve mopped up.
There is also this, Major. A video attachment. Putting it on- screen.
FX: CLUNKY SWITCHES, MONITOR POWERS UP
A transmission, eh? Good. It is some time since I saw the Imperial newsreel. Let us see how close the Five Hundredth have come to our death-tally.
No, Marshal. This is not from Sontar Command.
What then?
It appears to be a.. commercial.
FX: CHEESY INTRO MUSIC
(ON SCREEN) Sick of the same-old slaughter-appliances? In need
a killer new killing-machine? [...]
(FX: CHEESY AD CONTINUES, WITH SOUNDS OF BULLET-FIRING MAYHEM,
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 3
SCENE 2: INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: B/G TARDIS HUM
(ON SCREEN, CONTINUED) Then look no further. Garundel Galactic. For all your death-dealing needs...
FX: MORE MUSIC & MAYHEM THROUGH:
(ENTERING) Doctor, what are you doing? We’re looking for the most dangerous man on Earth.
(FOLLOWING) Or off it.
Hardly the time to catch up on your T.V. viewing.
Dr Klein. Mr Arrowsmith. I hope you’ve made yourselves at home. (FX: STOP AD, RAPID REWIND TO TOP) Take a look at this.
FX: PLAY AD FROM TOP:
(ON SCREEN) Sick of the same-old slaughter-appliances? [In need a killer new killing-machine? Then look no further. Garundel Galactic. For all your death-dealing needs...]
What is that?
Some sort of toad-man?
Urodelian. Native to the swamps of the third planet of the Urodel system. Notorious collectors and traders. Some might say thieves and pirates.
He certainly appears to have some amphibian ancestry. Although, I’d say the shape of the face and orbital sockets are quite different from those of a toad, Dr Klein.
Quite right, Will. That amphibian ancestry means Urodelians can re-grow parts of their body. Rather handy, given some of the more crudely punitive judicial regimes in this part of the galaxy.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 4
Like a salamander?
Exactly. This individual.. Garundel.. is a particularly slippery specimen.
You talk as if you know him.
A passing acquaintance. A long time ago.
It seems you’re in the habit of looking up old acquaintances...
But aren’t you glad I did?
I’1l let you know. (BEAT) So. Why him? Why now?
What’s stacked up behind him? Are those missiles?
Among other horrors. Listen, both of you.

(VIA VIEWSCREEN, VOLUME COMES UP) [.. So don’t miss this exclusive offer.] Roll up, roll up. For the sale of the millennium. Heck, the billennium! Blasters, tanks, missiles and bombs. No bang too big or micro-laser too small. If you’ve got the credits, I’ve got the kill-sticks. Cash buyers get preferential rates. Just name your method of destruction we’1l have something that fits the bill. Or the kill. [On application to attend, you become a preferred bidder, and you can browse our auction guide while you wait for the secret co-ordinates. ]
A giant frog running a closing-down weapons sale. It’s a curiosity, I admit. But I fail to see how it gets us any nearer-
FX: MESSAGE FAST-FORWARDS
This is the interesting part.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 5
(ON VIEWSCREEN) Trouble with hard to reach insurgents? Got a rebel faction you just can’t shift? The Persuasion Machine could be just what you need.
Persuasion Machine?

(ON VIEWSCREEN) Developed by Dr Kurt Schalk of Earth. Mid-20™ Century vintage. This was one ape-man way ahead of his time. Download our free catalogue, and you’1l see the full documentation confirming this as the genuine article.
Sounds familiar? Here, Elizabeth. Look at the catalogue.
FX: BEEPS OF TARDIS MONITOR
(ON VIEWSCREEN) The Persuasion Machine comes complete with owner manual stored in its creator’s brain. Purchase of the Machine and manual includes Kurt Schalk’s body at no extra charge.
Pause it, there!
FX: VIEWSCREEN PAUSED
That’s him! That’s Schalk!
Could be. Hard to tell, what with the hood and the cage.
He’s auctioning Dr Schalk? Along with his machine?
The power to change the way people think. Sold. To the highest bidder.
Who is this message being sent to? Who’s invited along to this... auction?
Oh, Garundel knows his market. He’s bombarding the secure channels of all the warlike species clustered around this part of space.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 6
You make it sound like the skies are teeming with them.
They are. This end of Mutter’s Spiral seems to attract the belligerent. Humans included. Must be the feng shui. As for your question, Mr Arrowsmith. ‘Who’s invited?’ We are.
You mean... You want us to go in there and buy Kurt Schalk?
No, Elizabeth. I want you to go in there and steal Kurt Schalk.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 3: INT. GARUNDEL’S SALES OFFICE
FX: BEEPING COUNTER OF SALES COMPUTER
(READING) Incoming. One-sixty. One-eighty... Two hundred thousand credits...
Fabulissimo! Move it all to the secure account and clear the buffers for the next one.
Looks like it’s gonna be a full house, Mr G.
Course it is! Chalk another one up to my natural showmanship. Take a missive, Miss Ziv... (CHUCKLES) Oooh, that’1ll never get old!
I’m on it Mr G. (FX: STARTS TYPING)
DICTATING) To the.. Supreme Royal House of Krellor. (ASIDE
Vicious bunch of lizards. But loaded with the riches of twelve systems. (BEAT) Don’t write that down.
Oh... (FX: HASTY DELETING)
(DICTATING) Thank you for your deposit which is gratefully received. Garundel Galactic Enterprises take great pleasure in confirming your attendance... Yadda, yadda, yadda.
Got it.
And send the co-ordinates.
FX: BEEPING COUNTER
Here comes another one.
This is going better than I’d dared hope. We already recouped what we paid the Spivelyn.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 8
Yeah, I thought they’d hold out for more.
Some goods are too hot to handle... This’ll be big. Maybe enough to retire. Got my eye on a land-mass on a little marsh-planet
near the Urodel system. Far enough from home so I can embargo
my siblings. But close enough for them to hear me rattling my
coinage.
FX: COUNTER COMPLETES ANOTHER SALE
One-eighty... One-ninety.. two hundred thousand creds. That’s a cool coupla million now, boss.
And that’s before they’ve even started the bidding. All goes to show — you get the right product, they’1ll kill themselves to find you.
Let’s hope they don’t start killing each other when they get here...
Oh, I think they can be persuaded otherwise...
Should I go ahead and send out the reply? Think I got the hang of it now...
Knock yourself out, Ziv-girl. I’m so glad the agency found me somebody so... adaptable.
It’s interesting work, Mr G. And I get to travel too.
Some people can get icky about their moral position. Selling weapons of mass destruction.
We all gotta make a living... It’s not like we’re pulling the triggers, is it?
See — that’s what I like about you. A rational outlook. Just like me. (FX: MORE CREDITS BEING RECEIVED) Forget the continent! Looks like I’m gonna be buying the whole planet...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 4: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, CORRIDOR
FX: VLAAR AND STENN WALKING ON METAL
(WALKING) I cannot believe Sontar Command have released funds to this... salesman.
(WALKING) It pains me to let a single credit pass to a creature like that. But.. (BEAT) I’d like you by my side, Major Vlaar. In case of complications. We’ll take your sphere down to the surface.
What race is it? This hawker of arms?
Urodelian. A breed of scavengers. Mercenaries. Bottom-feeders. They are beneath us.
Than why must we deal with it? Why not simply crush it in our fist?
High Command knows this... payment is for the greater good.
This is not the way Sontar fights. We use our might to subjugate. We do not... pay for favours.
(STOPPING) Vlaar. I tell you this because I trust you. But it goes no further.
(STOPPING) Marshal?
The Imperial Fleet is engaged across more than a thousand star systems. The clonebanks are at capacity. Why do you think we have seen no reinforcements?
The Six-Twentieth needs no special treatment...
We began our campaign with thirty capsules. We now have six.
They all died well.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 10
I do not deny that. But hatchlings are in demand on every front. It is regrettable, but we must find new ways of waging war. To prevent the Rutans gaining ground.
Death to the Rutan scum! Glory to Sontar!

Indeed. (BEAT) This Persuasion device... This Terran scientist. Both are sought by many races. Our orders are to secure them. If only to prevent others gaining the advantage. Others who may assist the Rutan Host.

The Six-Twentieth is Sontar’s finest attack squad! We destroyed the Rutan fleet at Wendron’s Pass. We eradicated the assembled hordes of the Velosions in the Seventh System. We are not... errand-boys to be sent... shopping.

Respect the chain of command, Major Vlaar. High Command has good reason. Besides. We will flex our muscles soon enough. No more credits will be wasted on this costermonger.. As far as he is concerned, Marshal Stenn, veteran of the Six-Twentieth Attack Fleet, is simply... browsing.
FX: COMMS SIGNAL
Sergeant Gredd. Report.
(VIA COM) All is prepared, Marshal. We have the final co- ordinates.
(WALKING ON) Lead the way to your capsule, Major.
(FOLLOWING) For the glory of Sontar!
For the glory of Sontar.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 5: INT. TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: B/G HUM. KLEIN ENTERS IN BOOTS & CREAKING LEATHER
I feel ridiculous.
You look rather... striking, ma’am. If you don’t mind me saying... sorry.
And you look preposterous. Doctor, couldn’t you have found him a uniform that fitted?
So. Commander Elizarra Klineforth of the Zebrednik Horde. Meet Captain Will-Valar. Your man-at-arms.
Is all this leather really necessary?
You have to look the part, Elizabeth.
So. What about you? You haven’t even changed. What have you come as?
Your getaway driver.
The Doctor’s not actually going in with us.
I’m afraid I can’t join you at the auction itself. As I said, Garundel knows me of old. I would only raise suspicion.
And me dressed as a fetish queen from Mars wouldn’t?

Mr Arrowsmith and I scanned the TARDIS database to find some appropriate profiles. The Lost Warlords of Zebrednik. From far enough away that few would know them. But near enough to plausibly make the trip.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 12

Their physiognomy is close enough to human as makes no odds. Strange how evolution progressed on some of the outer rimworlds... I’ve always found it fascinating how many of Earth’s invaders resembled us so closely in so many ways. And even those who didn’t still appear at the very least to have evolved from a similar physical structure... I wonder if there’s a biological template of sorts, whether-
(INTERRUPTING) Now. Mr Arrowsmith. Would you like to present arms to your leader? Imagine she’s a fearsome warrior queen with no compassion. No sympathy of any kind.
(FLUSTERED) I- I- Well of course... I’d never actually think that of you ma’am.. but for the purposes of the undercover mission... Would you mind terribly if I-
FX: WILL FUMBLES WITH WEAPONS
(SOTTO, SMILING) I can’t imagine it’s too much of a stretch.
I heard that, Doctor.
FX: WEAPON FALLS TO FLOOR
Oops. Sorry! Heavier than it looks.
Look out! Is this wise, Doctor? He’s going to vaporise us if he’s not careful.
Don’t worry. They’re not loaded.
Oh, that makes me feel so much safer...

Besides, the auction operates under an amnesty. As soon as you arrive, all weapons must be surrendered to the host. It’s in the small print. That multi-photon rifle is only for show. Now: we’re about to arrive on the planetoid where Garundel has pitched his stall. (GIVING KLEIN AND WILL COMMUNICATORS) Here. Take these.
(TAKING PHONE) What are they? Communication devices?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 13
Yes. They certainly date your Dictaphone, Mr Arrowsmith.

Garundel has scramblers and jammers criss-crossing the sales dome, but there are gaps around the edges. These twenty-first century mobile telephones are actually our best bet for keeping in touch. I’ve lashed up a network via the TARDIS. So long as you’ve two bars on the display, we should be able to hear each other.
(FX: PRESSING BUTTONS ON PHONE) Voice-recorder... stopwatch... camera... some kind of... video-game? ‘Furious Avians’?
I thought you might like them. They’re only a few years into your future. Communication is about to make a quantum leap. Internet, email, Twitter. All the rage come the twenty-teens.
When you’ve quite finished showing off your gadgets — I do have one question, Doctor.
Yes, Elizabeth?
What if the real versions of our aliases turn up?
Ah.. That’s the thing about the ‘Lost Warlords of Zebrednik’. (BEAT) They’re lost.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 6: INT. SALES DOME, FOYER
(FX: MILLING ALIENS, GROWLS, MUTTERING, MUZAK IN B/G, SWISH OF
DOORS)

(CALLING) Welcome, welcome. One and all. Please... Don’t stand on ceremony. We’re all friends here. You’re entitled to a complimentary beverage of your choice. Fell free to scan for any life-threatening additives before consumption. And don’t forget to hand your weapons in at reception. We’re all about the trust here at Garundel Galactic.
(FX: GROWLING CREATURE SCANS A DRINK BEFORE TAKING, AND
OFF)
There ya go fella. Won’t kill ya. We’re all on equal terms here. (SOTTO) All that matters is the size of your wallet.
(APPROACHING) Mr G. May I introduce Krakenmother Benarra. Queen of the Krellor systems. And her Squire, Asalla.
Urodelian. How long am I to tarry with these... degenerates?
No need to be so formal. Please, call me Garundel, Benarra. Can I call you Benarra?
No, you cannot. Urodelian.
Thank you, Ziv. Best get back to the front desk. (TO BENARRA) Can I offer you a refreshment before the auction? Orange? Tomato juice? Gamorrean wine?
The only refreshment I require is the spine-fluid of my enemies once I have crushed the life from their pitiful bodies.
Hmm. We’re right out of spine fluid. (BEAT) Tempt you with an elderflower cordial?
We will wait for the weapons.
My associate is just welcoming the last few guests. Then we can get this show on the road.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 15
FX: SWISH OF ENTRANCE DOORS, STOMPING SONTARANS, OFF
Ah - looks like the Sontarans are here.
Sontarans? (SPITS) You invite those stunted clones to your auction?
This is an outrage. Sontarans? (SPITS) What other vermin infest this place? Who next? Bandrils?

That a problem? I like to think I offer a haven from all the warmongering so you can recharge and begin the slaughter afresh. With all-new toys. (HARDER) We’re not gonna have any trouble, are we, Krakenmother? I want us all to play nice while we’re here.
I will take pleasure in outbidding them at every sale.
Good-good. (GOING OFF) The Bandrils sent their excuses, by the way...
(SOTTO) And then eviscerating them as soon as we are ready to depart. Come, Asalla!
(NASTY LAUGH) It will be a pleasure, Krakenmothexr...
FX: CROSS TO:
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 7: INT. SALES DOME, RECEPTION [CONTINUOUS ]
FX: MILLING CROWD, OFF
Thank you for coming along to Garundel Galactic today. I hope you found our secret location without any trouble. Pleasant journey?
All lesser races flee before a Sontaran Command Ship.
Course they do. Could have done with you on the Kessel run last month! Got stuck on the planetary bypass for three days.
GRUNTS
If I could just have your names, please? Check you off my list.
I am Major Vlaar. This is Marshal Stenn of the Sontaran Empire’s Six-Twentieth Attack Fleet. Bloodletter of the Ninth Moon of Velos. Ravager of the Doghead Nebula.
(TYPING) And how are you spelling that...
What?
Bloodletter.. Is that two T’s or one? For the badge.
What is the creature saying, Vlaar? I need no badge.
You heard the Marshal, female. A Sontaran Officer needs no badge.
But you do kind of... look the same... (BEAT) OK.
(FX: SCRUNCHES UP PAPER) No badge. But I do need to check in your weapons. That’s two.. rifles... and one.. laser stick? What do you call that thing?
A Sontaran Marshal does not relinquish his swagger-stick.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 17
It did say on the invitation... Erm.. Just one second... (CALLS) Mr G!
Besides. I am Sontaran. My body is a weapon. The most perfect weapon ever devised.
Ooooh..Kay. (BEAT, LOUDER) Mr G!
(ARRIVING) Hey, what’s the hold-up? Not a problem, I hope? Hello representatives of the mighty Sontaran Empire! You know, I look at you guys, and I think... disintegrators. (SOTTO) That, and heels.
What?
Disintegrators. You’re in the market for some planetary disintegrators, I’1ll bet. (OFFERING HAND) Garundel. Of Garundel Galactic. Pleasure to meet you.
Your minion requests our weapons. And that we wear identification.
I did say we could make an exception on the badges, Mr Stenn.
Marshal Stenn.
Marshal? I like that name. I went out with a guy called Marshal once. He used to live over in the-
It is not a name. It is a rank.
So sorry, Marshal, Major. My assistant is very new to all this... Still training her up...
(BEGINNING TO PROTEST) Wha-?!
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 18

(SOTTO) Go with it, sweetie.. (ALOUD) Listen. I know, and you know — Sontaran officers do not need a weapon to decimate the field. If things turn nasty... Hand-to-hand combat... I know who my money’s on.
That is good. You... recognise the might of the unarmed Sontaran warrior.

Let you into a little secret, guys. There’s an E.M. field around this whole sales dome, so energy weapons are pretty much useless. Except maybe as clubs. Which I’m sure a big tough soldier like you just wouldn’t need.
Here, girl. Take care of my arms. They are precious. Major. Give her your Meson rifle.
FX: WEAPONS PLACED IN CONTAINER AND BOX ELECTRONICALLY SEALED
See. They’re sealed away. Safe and secure.
We'll take care of your weapons like they were your babies, Marshal.
I sent eight of my clonespawn into the Doghead Nebula. (PROUD) They did not return.

Even better, then. We’ll take care of your weapons like they were your.. weapons. Miss Ziv will lock them up in our security pantry. Same goes for all the other guests. They’1ll be safe and sound. Alongside all our own auction items, of course. Your security is our prime concern.
All done. In you go.
Come Vlaar. Let us see what alien scum we have to contend with.
FX: SONTARANS STOMP PAST
(WHISPER) Sorry Mr G. Did I mess up?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 19
(TO ZIV) No, no. You gotta go with the flow sometimes, little buddy...
(TO GARUNDEL) But Sontarans.. Ain’t that a bit of a risk? Inviting the likes of them?
(TO ZIV) I know... Everybody hates ‘em. But they’re loaded, so everybody’s gonna try and outbid them. I asked them along to push the prices up.
Oooh. You are clever, Mr G.
You better believe it, blue.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 8: EXT. PLANETOID, OUTSIDE SALES DOME
FX: WIND WHISTLING ACROSS DESERT, TARDIS DEMATERIALISES
So. We’re here. (BEAT) Where are we again?
It doesn’t have a name. Planetoid Q-987. A.. (UNSURE) G-class? No, J-class planetoid. Uninhabited. No natural resources. No strategic value. It’s basically an insignificant rock in space.
You seem to have got the hang of the TARDIS databases. I’11l give you that, Mr Arrowsmith.
Thank you. Ma’am.
Drop the ma’am. It’s Commander, remember. ‘Wil-valar’.
Yes. Yes, of course. Commander.
That dome over there. I suppose that must be our destination.
A desert on a boulder in the middle of nowhere. Just the sort of place you’d open a branch of Guns R Us.
(SETTING OFF) Come on.
FX: WALKING OVER SAND
FX: MOBILE RINGTONE, KLEIN ANSWERS
Doctor? You couldn’t resist trying out your technology.
(DISTORT, VIA PHONE) Elizabeth. Didn’t you know? It’s good to talk.
I’1ll put you on speaker.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 21

(D, SPEAKER) My preliminary scans have found a concealed hatchway. Fifty metres from the sales dome. By the rocks. Looks like a secure bunker. Even the TARDIS is having trouble scanning it. I’m almost certain that’s where Schalk is being held. If you could find a way of lowering its shielding, I might be able to land inside... (FX: ALARM IN TARDIS)
What’s that noise? Doctor?
(D, SPEAKER) Can’t hang around too long, I’m afraid. They’11l pick me up on the next sweep.
So you’re going into temporal orbit?
(D) Very good, Mr Arrowsmith. I won’t be far. Ready to land just as soon as you give the signal.
(SARCASTIC) What could possibly go wrong?
(D) That’s the spirit, Elizabeth! Happy bidding!
FX: SPEAKER OFF
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 9: INT. SALES DOME, RECEPTION
FX: ALIENS MILLING, OFF
Help yourself to the courtesy Cristal. Another crostini?
FX: ALIEN GRUNT
Sure, take twelve...
(WHISPER) Mr G. Dunno if it’s a problem... But the proximity sensors picked... something up. Just for a second. A ship. But not a ship. Like nuffink we got on record.
But it’s gone now?
Totally.
Hmmm. Just a blip. No doubt there are all kinds wanting to stick their noses, beaks, and assorted mandibles in. Keep an eye on the sensors. You got all the weapons stashed?
Yep. Our... guest’s smelling pretty ripe.
That’s OK. Won’t be holding him much longer. Anyways, I’m almost out of vivifiers. Everybody here?
All guests accounted for... except...
FX: DOORS SWISH, WILL AND KLEIN ENTER
Ah. That’1l be them.
(GOING OVER) Hello! You must be the Zebrednik party. Glad you could make it. Let’s get you checked in.
Thank you.
If I could just take your names...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 23
FX: ZIV TYPING

I am Wil-valar of the Lost Zebrednik Warlords. Sorry... ‘Warlords of Zebrednik.’ And this is my commanding officer. Elizarra Klineforth. Also of the.. er Lost Warlords. Of Zebrednik. (BEAT) That’s N-I-K. No C.
Ta babes.

I leave you in the capable hands of my associate. Miss Ziv. OK... (CLAPPING HANDS, CALLING) If everyone could assemble in the main hall in five minutes. I know you’re all keen to get back to your killing and maiming. (GOING OFF) So let’s see if we can’t fit you out with some new accoutrements.
FX: MILLING ALIEN CROWD MOVES TO HALL
Looks like you’re very busy today.
Yes we are, babes. Mr G is a whiz at the old marketing.
FX: PRINTING BADGES
So it appears. A very smooth operator.
Here we are. (HANDING OVER BADGES) One for you, Commander Klineforth and one for you, Wil-valar.
Call me Will.

OK. One last thing for check-in. If I could just take your guns... Thanks so much. (FX: WEAPONS BEING HANDED OVER) I’11 store them away in here. They’1l be held in our security pantry for the duration of the sale.
FX: ZIV LOCKS WEAPONS IN BOX
Do you want a hand with that? It looks rather heavy. All that firepower must weigh a ton...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 24
Aww. You’re a sweetie. But look.
FX: ACTIVATION HUM OF HOVER-TROLLEY
Hover-trolley. Even a little thing like me can push it around. (GOING OFF) See ya later!
Will... (REMEMBERS ALIAS) -valar. Stay here. Keep an eye on this Miss Ziv. She seems to like you.

Do you think so? I’m never very good at reading those kinds of Signals. Particularly difficult, what with the antennae and... everything. But yes. Yes. It seems logical that she’d have security clearance. Handling the weapons, I mean. It could definitely be worthwhile. What about you, ma’am?
I’ll have a recce. Try and find a signal. (WALKING OFF) Let’s see if the Doctor’s toys actually work...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 10: INT. SALES DOME, FOYER
FX: MILLING ALIENS, GROWLS, MUTTERING, MUZAK IN B/G
Look at them. The lesser species. They dare to call themselves warriors. (GETTING ANGRY) Look! There! Farenians. They allied themselves with the Rutans on Borinor, I will-

(HOLDING HIM BACK) Wait Major. I know it goes against your instincts. But we must play this game for a short time at least. It is clear that none of these aliens should be allowed to take the Persuasion device.
And we will see to it they will not. (ANNOYED GRUNT) I do not know how you contain yourself so calmly, Marshal.
High Command has deemed it necessary. Think of the end. Not the means.
Look at that one. The Krelloran. She calls herself the Krakenmother. She glares at us. (ANGRY GRUNT) Now she is gone.
FX: BEEPING OF COMMUNICATOR
Hm. Our signals are blocked. Perhaps it is this Urodelian’s electro-magnetic field. We will need to find an unshielded transmission location.
No doubt all communication will be monitored.
I have anticipated this. Gredd has his orders. You need only send the signal. Then. Weapon or no weapon, you can set about these aliens.
I will run bio-scans for Rutan spies.
FX: VLAAR OPERATES SCANNING DEVICE
Carry on, Major Vlaar. We need not maintain this sham for long.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 11: INT. SALES DOME, CORRIDOR
FX: FOOTSTEPS IN EMPTY CORRIDOR, FAINT MUZAK
FX: PHONE SPEAKER BEEPING
(TO PHONE) Doctor... Come in Doctor. (FRUSTRATED) Ah... signal lost!
FX: INTERFERENCE
Nothing. The shielding’s too strong.
(VIA PHONE, HEAVY INTERFERENCE) Come in ‘Commander Klineforth’. Are you receiving?
(INTO PHONE) Doctor? I can barely hear you...
(D) Keep moving. There’s a communication bubble. Ten metres ahead of you...
FX: KLEIN WALKING
(INTO PHONE) Doctor? Do you hear me now?

It seems to be just the two of them. They’re selling the items in batches. All those at the front are up next. While Garundel takes the bids, Ziv fetches the next set of demonstration devices. That’s how it’s worked so far anyway. They seem to be rattling through the catalogue.

I see. All the auction items and all the customers’ valuables. All in one place.

GARUNDEL: And we’re on one-twenty. That’s what I like to see. One-forty. One-fifty. And one-eighty.
GARUNDEL: Going once at one eighty. Do I hear another bid?
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 46
DOCTOR WHO: Yes! Two hundred thousand credits. Any advance on that? OK, going once, going twice-
CONTINUES: BELOW]
CONTINUES: [OVER GARUNDEL’S AUCTION:
VLAAR: (CLOSE) See. My scan of all lifeforms in attendance. No trace of any Rutan spies. But as we thought. Several species from the Madelaine Cluster. Close to the Host homeworlds.
STENN: Then we would do well to eliminate them first.
VLAAR: But look. I have also found this. Compared to the DNA profile of Lot seven-four-nine in the brochure...
STENN: Human. Did we not know the Zebrednik had human heritage?
VLAAR: Yes, but more than just the species... It shows an exact genetic match. Though they are from worlds a thousand light years apart.
STENN: That is interesting. And bears further investigation. Once all the elements are in our hands.
OVERLAP: ENDS]
GARUNDEL: (ON PA) Was that a bid, Marshal? No? OK. Sold to the Phalanx of Arpistan. The Kasubal disintegrator. For two hundred thousand. Thanks fellas.
GARUNDEL: Now. Moving on. The one you’ve all been waiting for. Lot seven- four-nine. The Persuasion Machine. As explained in the catalogue. This comes complete with the creator’s own mind. With optional life support system.
GARUNDEL: In other words, the brain’s still in the body. But hey, those things can be expensive to keep, so any little modifications you need... dig away. Who’s gonna get me started?
GARUNDEL: Cat got your tongues? I think we all know how this is gonna go. So let’s start as we mean to go on. Do I hear half a mill?
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 47
BENARRA: (ACROSS HALL, CALLING) Here, Urodelian.
GARUNDEL: Thank you, Krakenmother...
STENN: (CLOSE) It is time, Vlaar.
VLAAR: (CLOSE) At last, Marshal.
STENN: (CLOSE) Go to the corridor. Send the signal to Gredd.
VLAAR: Aye Marshal.
STENN: Enough of this subterfuge. Sontar will claim what is ours by right of might.
GARUNDEL: Too rich for one Sontaran’s blood, I see. Oh, sorry, Marshal...
GARUNDEL: Is that a bid?
STENN: (ALOUD) Sontar bids five million credits.
GARUNDEL: (SOTTO) Come to poppa...
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 48
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 21: INT. WEAPON STORE
DOCTOR: (EMERGING FROM TARDIS) Well done Mr Arrowsmith! I- Ah.
ZIV: Bang, bang. You’re dead.
DOCTOR: I really should start checking the scanner before leaving the TARDIS...
ZIV: What d’you expect, old fella? Landing in a weapon store. There are gonna be some weapons.
WILL: Sorry, Doctor. She pulled the gun on me just as you landed. I really didn’t think she was like that. I’m so bad at reading the signals...
DOCTOR: No need to apologise, Will. And young lady. Please don’t be afraid. We are only here for...
ZIV: Just keep walking, mister.
DOCTOR: Hmm... You’re not afraid are you? You know exactly what you’re doing.
ZIV: And what I’m doing is nothing to do with you. Keep walking to the hatchway.
DOCTOR: Very well. (WALKING) What about my friend? Will... Are you unharmed?
WILL: I’m OK, Doctor. Just not used to having so many guns pointed at me.
ZIV: Brainbox here is totally safe. No offense, old-timer. But he’s prettier than you. And you never know when you might need a hostage.
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 49
DOCTOR: All right, I’m at the hatch. Now, release my-
DOCTOR: Aaa-!
WILL: Doctor!
ZIV: Don’t worry. Only scorched his shoes. I’ma brilliant shot. (AT CONTROLS) Hello. Looks like we’ve got incoming. Five Sontaran battle-spheres descending through the atmosphere. And a Command Ship. I knew it was a bad idea to ask them along.
WILL: The planet’s being invaded? But that dome’s a sitting duck! They’1l be into this... security pantry in no time at all!
ZIV: You think? Feeling a teensy bit sorry for Mr G, now. Looks like I timed this to perfection. OK. Let’s get this show on the road.
WILL: Oh my... This isn’t a storeroom at all...
ZIV: You catch on quick, babes. Now buckle up, this take-off’s not gonna be pretty!
ZIV: (FX: WHIRRING ENGINES POWERING UP. SIMULTANEOUSLY, DOCTOR BANGING ON OUTSIDE OF HATCH)
DOCTOR: (CALLING, OUTSIDE SHIP) Young lady! Please! Open this door!
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 50
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 22: EXT. PLANETOID
DOCTOR: I said — open this door! Will — get out of there! That’s not a storeroom, it’s a spaceship!
DOCTOR: (FX: GROUND CRACKS. ROCKS AND SAND CRUMBLE AWAY, ROAR OF
ENGINES: AS SHIP TAKES OFF)
DOCTOR: (OVER ENGINES) A spaceship that’s about to [take off! ]
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 51
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 23: INT. SALES DOME, SALES HALL
GARUNDEL: So. We’re on half a billion credits. Any advance on five hundred million credits...?
GARUNDEL: (SOTTO) My palpitations are having palpitations here...
GARUNDEL: Thank you. Tublash Entity. That’s.. six hundred million. (GULP) Any advance.
GARUNDEL: Hey. All communication devices should be switched off.
GARUNDEL: (FX: MORE COMMS BEEPS, DELEGATES MUTTERING AS THEY GET
MESSAGES: )
MESSAGES: What’s the commotion? I’m about to close the deal of a lifetime here.
MESSAGES: (FX: MUFFLED HYPERSHIP TAKE-OFF OUTSIDE, FOLLOWED BY SONTARAN
SPHERES: LANDING)
SPHERES: Marshal Stenn. You wanna bid?
STENN: (STANDING) I have no need. Garundel. This auction is over. Tublash. You will not take this device for your Rutan conspirators!
GARUNDEL: Hey. No! Stop it! No fighting! I forbid you to kill the highest bidder!
GARUNDEL: (FX: DEATH THROES OF TENTACLED ALIEN ENTITY BEING THROTTLED AND THROWN TO FLOOR)
STENN: There! The Tublash Entity is no more!
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 52
GARUNDEL: Ew.. Strangled with his own tentacles... Not a good way to go... (ANGRY) I hope your credit’s good, Marshal. Cos you’re gonna have to recompense every last cent I’m owed...
STENN: I have already said.
GARUNDEL: What? What was that?
STENN: This auction is over. The Sontaran Empire claims this rock. And everything on it.
GARUNDEL: The roof! What are you doing to my dome!
BENARRA: (GETTING UP) Look to the skies. You are betrayed, Urodelian. The Sontarans have brought an invasion fleet! The alien scum are attacking! (GOING OFF) Asalla. With me. Call the fleet. We will take a vessel from one of these lesser races.
BENARRA: (FX: BLADE DRAWN, SLICING AN ALIEN, GENERAL FIGHTING BREAKS OUT)
GARUNDEL: (PANICKING) Sale abandoned. Every alien for himself.
GARUNDEL: (FX: FOLLOW HIM AS HE RUNS THROUGH FIGHTING DELEGATES INTO
CORRIDOR: )
GARUNDEL: Shoulda known this was a bad idea. But hey. I got a few sales through on the credit account... And the good thing is. I got all the guns.
GARUNDEL: (FX: EMERGING OUT ONTO PLANETOID SURFACE. SONTARANS BLASTING
RUNNING: ALIENS AND FURTHER OFF, BLOWING UP THEIR SHIPS)
GARUNDEL: Right outside in my... (BEAT) Oh heck.
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 53
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 24: EXT. PLANETOID, OUTSIDE SALES DOME
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: ALIENS RUNNING, DESCENDING SONTARAN SPHERES, FIRING AT
ALIEN: DELEGATES. STENN STRIDES THROUGH THE CHAOS )
KLEIN: (HURRYING) It’s a massacre.
STENN: (STRIDING) This is not a battle. This is simply crowd control.
VLAAR: (CATCHING UP) Marshal. Our spheres have destroyed all alien vessels on the ground. The rest have been engaged on take-off. They are no match for the Six-Twentieth!
STENN: Good. Here. Trooper. Give me that rifle.
VLAAR: Sergeant Gredd reports one unarmed hypership departed shortly before the others. No identification. It is beyond the upper atmosphere, but he is tracking it. Look. Your Command Ship is here, Marshal.
STENN: Accompany me, Commander Klineforth. You are to be spared. For now.
KLEIN: I’m sorry... But my... man-at-arms. I should try to find him-
STENN: (FX: GRABBING KLEIN) Your loyalty is noted. But that was not a request.
VLAAR: Sir. Our scans show the other Zebrednik boarded the hypership before take-off.
KLEIN: Thank goodness for that.
STENN: You are pleased your equerry is a thief?
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 54
KLEIN: No. He had nothing to do with it. It was a mistake... Please you must go after that ship.
STENN: Oh, I intend to...
VLAAR: Gredd says the Krelloran fleet are decloaking. At least twenty ships hidden in the mesosphere.
STENN: Of course. The Krakenmother and her Squire were very swift leave the dome.
VLAAR: They commandeered the Fanerian vessel. To rejoin their fleet.
STENN: Ah! An enemy worth fighting. Twenty ships, you say? Now my heart pumps faster. The pursuit must wait, there is Krelloran blood to be spilt!
KLEIN: Marshal Stenn! Behind you!
STENN: (FIRING RIFLE) Die, Tublash scum!
VLAAR: A fine shot sir! Permission to leave, Marshal. To board my
VLAAR: capsule. To join the fray!
STENN: Go, Major Vlaar. For the glory of Sontar.
VLAAR: (RUNNING OFF) Aye Marshal. For the glory of Sontar!
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 55
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 25: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
GREDD: Marshal on the bridge.
STENN: Thank you Sergeant. Take us up. We shall obliterate these lizards’ fleet.
KLEIN: Can’t we just get after the — what did you call it? - hypership?
STENN: Secure her. (TO KLEIN) Do not be under any illusion. Klineforth. Or whoever you may be.
KLEIN: What do you mean by that?
STENN: You are not a guest. You are a prisoner.
GREDD: Upper stratosphere, Marshal.
STENN: On screen.
KLEIN: There aren’t just twenty ships...
STENN: (RELISHING IT) No. There are two-by-twenty.
KLEIN: And how many do you have?
STENN: We have six gravity spheres and this Command Ship.
KLEIN: So you’re surrounded. Outnumbered.
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 56
STENN: Once battle is joined, the numbers do not matter. Only the outcome of the contest itself. (FX: FLICKS COMMS SWITCH) Do you read me, Major Vlaar?
VLAAR: (D) Marshal.
STENN: Engage them.
KLEIN: But it’s suicide!
STENN: ‘Su-i-cide’? We have no word for.. such a thing. Sergeant Gredd. Full speed. Let us take the fight to the Krakenmother!
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 57
DOCTOR WHO: SCENE 26: EXT. PLANETOID
DOCTOR: Ms Klein? Mr Arrowsmith? Anyone? Can you read me?
DOCTOR: (FX: GARUNDEL’S BLASTER SHOT AS IN ‘BLACK AND WHITE’ — PHONE
EXPLODES: )
GARUNDEL: I think you lost your signal.
DOCTOR: Oh no...
GARUNDEL: Long time no parlay, Time Lord.
DOCTOR: Garundel.
GARUNDEL: Aww, but you’re all on your ownsome. Did all your friends up and leave you? (FX: COCKS BLASTER) Never mind — you, me and my blaster can still have a party.
GARUNDEL: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 58

elements.text: PART THREE
Long time no parlay, Time Lord.
Garundel.
Aww, but you’re all on your ownsome. Did all your friends up and leave you? (FX: COCKS BLASTER) Never mind — you, me and my blaster can still have a party.
SCENE 27: EXT. PLANETOID (CONTINUOUS)
FX: SKY BATTLE RECEDING THROUGH
Get up. You’re coming with me, little fella.
(GETTING UP) You’re not going to shoot me?
Why'd I wanna do a thing like that.. so soon? Before we’ve even had a chance to catch up!
I can’t believe you’d spare my life for the sake of a chit- chat.
No, but we need to get after my double-dealing deputy. Two heads and four hands are better than one. (ASIDE) Though that didn’t help the Fanerians...
One of my friends is in your hypership.
Oh, we'll be catching up with that little number, don’t you fret. Your lady pal hopped on board with the Sontarans.
Then let’s get after them.
FX: WALKING ACROSS SAND PAST SMOKING WRECKAGE
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 59
(WALKING) See, I knew you’d be incentivised. I don’t need the blaster to persuade you. But it’s still pointed at your back. I like to be thorough.
(WALKING) Yes... what about your Persuasion Machine? You’re leaving it behind?

(WALKING) Oh, naive little Time lord. There’s no Persuasion Machine back there. My demos are mock-ups. I got a comms block, sure. But no E.M. field could stop all the weapons those guys brought with them. I just needed a little nudge so everyone believed that. Keep the peace. Thought you’d approve.
(WALKING) Let me guess. There’s an active Persuasion prototype in that ship of yours. The one that just left.

(WALKING) It works... but it’s a little limited, shall we say. Range, strength and time. ‘Persuasion-lite’, I call it. Not much use in a battle situation, but ideal to prime folks for a little retail therapy.
You actually built it? (STOPS) Whatever else you might be, Garundel, I can’t deny your technical genius.
Gee, thanks. Don’t get carried away though. The ‘fluence only works for two hours. Why d’you think I was in such a hurry?
So. The most dangerous device in the universe. And you use it to carry out a confidence trick. To steal their weapons as well as their money.

You know how much Sontaran Meson rifles fetch on the black market? Would have worked too. Just wasn’t expecting little Miss Blue to rip me off. Shoulda known that girl was too good to be true. Her antennae were too close together.
That’s not important now. You had the blueprints. But did you ever actually have its creator, I wonder?
Oh, I got Schalk all right. In the hypership. Anyhoo — here we are.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 60
FX: SCRAPING SAND AWAY
Your podcraft. Buried in the sand.
(FX: GARUNDEL OPERATES CONTROL, BURIED PODCRAFT HATCH OPENS,
B/G AS IN ‘BLACK AND WHITE’ )
Old faithful. This baby’s seen me through good times and bad. Patched up a dozen times over.
Just like its owner.
(RUBBING NECK) Yeah... I blame you for my recurring whiplash. Always gotta wear a collar now. Maybe I should sue...
(CLIMBING INTO PODCRAFT) Shall we?
As if you got a choice...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 61
SCENE 28: INT. HYPERSHIP (WEAPON STORE)
FX: IN FLIGHT, VROOMING ENGINES, ASTEROIDS FLYING PAST
(HOLDING ONTO HIS CHAIR, ABOVE ENGINE NOISE) You really shouldn’t have done that, Ziv. Thrown the Doctor out. He could have helped.
(ABOVE ENGINES) Story of my life.. Always doing things I shouldn’a. You sit tight and let Zivvy take you for the ride of your life. (SOTTO) I don’t need anyone’s help...
FX: ENGINES SWERVE, SHIPS CONTENTS RATTLE ABOUT
Please. Turn us around. Take us back to that planet.
I mean it, babes. Sit there. Don’t distract. We’ll be out of this asteroid belt before you know it. (FIGHTING CONTROLS) Just gotta concentrate for a minute.
(UNCONVINCING) I- I demand you take us back!

Aw, bless. You don’t want me to have to tie you up do you? Maybe save that for later, eh? (FX: CHECKING SCANNER) No — scanner says the sky back there’s so full of plasma-fire we'd fry soon as we turn around. Nip through a full-scale space- battle? No, ta — I’1ll take the asteroids, fanks very much.
But I have to get back to my friends. We only came here looking for him. The man in the cage. Dr Schalk. I take it you do know there’s a sedated human being in there?
(BUSY STEERING) Yeah... Funny that. Wondered why Mr G brought him along. Not like he even matches his write-up in the brochure or anyfink. Not exactly sedated either. Another fake, I guess.
What do you mean? Another fake? (ALARMED) Ziv! Watch out for that-
FX: ENGINES SWERVE
Meteor? (BEAT) Hush now, babes. I’m tryin’ to drive...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 62
SCENE 29: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL — BRIDGE
FX: ENGINES, CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE
(FX: EXTERNAL LASERS AND EXPLOSIONS, SPACE BATTLE BETWEEN SONTARANS AND KRELLORANS )
You’re outnumbered. Hopelessly outnumbered.
(ENJOYING HIMSELF) How soon you abandon hope! Little wonder your world lies destroyed.
Destroyed? What do you mean? Earth is still- (BREAKS OFF) Oh.
Terran. I knew it. The scans were correct.
What scans?
You say we are outnumbered. Did you never hear the Sontar Saying: the greater the odds, the greater the glory! This is what we were bred for.
FX: COMMUNICATIONS SIGNAL
It’s Major Vlaar, Marshal.
Go ahead, Major.
(D) We’ve eliminated half the Krelloran fighters. Twenty-two remain with four attack-freighters and the leadship.
Good. Take four spheres around the leadship. To the other side of that moon. You remember... the Vanoonian gambit?
(D) Aye Marshal. The Vanoonian gambit. (CHUCKLES) An excellent strategy.
What are you doing? The main force is straight ahead.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 63
I suspected your Zebrednik name was a disguise... You are an infiltrator. A Terran. But... are you a military officer?
Not exactly. I have some military connections.
Are females of your world allowed such privileges?
The ‘females of my world’ are more privileged than you in many ways.
(SNORT OF DERISION) A primitive society. Where the egg-bearer still has a role. We have eliminated that weakness.
I wouldn’t say it was a weakness.
Ah. Have you reproduced?
Erm. No... But I-
(OVER HER) Then your opinion is invalid. Gredd. You know the target. Fire at will.
Yes, Marshal. Fire!
FX: BLAST OF EXTERNAL LASER CANNON
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 64
SCENE 30: INT. GARUNDEL’S PODCRAFT
FX: GLOOPY AMBIENCE, IN FLIGHT
There we go. Leaving the atmosphere. Can’t say I’m sad to see the back of that rock. Ooh. That way’s a no-no. Too much... shooty-stuff.
You said my friend Dr Klein was on that Sontaran Command Vessel.
(FX: FLICKING SWITCHES) First things first Doc. I’ve made a few upgrades. You recognise the old place?
Only too well. You found your way back to your ‘mothers’ ship?
Eventually. The long way back. Things had changed. I missed out on my birthright. It’s no fun when sixty siblings kick you out.
Perhaps not. But probably no more than you deserved.
I realised I work best on my own. (TO SELF) Should have remembered that. (TO DOCTOR) So I made a few modifications to my little podcraft. Extended the range to interstellar.
(FX: PRESSING BUTTONS) Yes... these drive systems. A hyper-star core. And warp shielding too.
I know some guys. Who know some guys. Who are missing their hyper-star core and warp shielding.
(FIDDLING WITH SYSTEMS) Very impressive. You installed it... so why do you need me?
Look at you, poking and prodding away. Just as I expected. You know these drive systems. I’m guessing you’1ll have some tricks up your sleeve to speed us along.
I might be able to give them a boost. Yes.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 65
FX: SONIC SCREWDRIVER
That sonic gizmo of yours. How much you want for it?
(WORKING WITH SONIC) It’s not for sale.
Oh. I’m forgetting. I’1ll just pluck it from your cold dead hand.
You know how to drive a bargain, Garundel.
I need you to keep doing what you’re doing. ‘Specially if we’re gonna beat the Sontarans to the chase.
I want to find my friends. That’s all.
(MOCKING) ‘You want..’? Way I see it. You don’t have a choice.
There’s always a choice...
So how are the new recruits working out? The ice queen and the test-tube kid. Warlord of Zebrednik? Ha! That boy ain’t seen the outside of a science lab in months.
You knew they were with me?
Thing about my comms shield blindspot. Gives me a nice clear channel to listen in on everyone using it.
I should have realised... (FX: FINISHES WORKING, CLOSES HATCH) There. I’ve looped the drive output so you’ve the equivalent of six hyper-stars.
(FX: ENGINE PITCH RISES) Ooooh. And six times the speed. I knew you’d come through, Doc. Now get over there.
I thought you didn’t need the blaster to persuade me?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 66
Just makin’ sure. So. Why the newbies? What happened to all your old pals? The sisters with the guns, and that nurse fella with the funny voice?
Things... happened. (BEAT) Such a long time ago now.
But you gotta move on. Like me, you don’t let the swamp-grass grow.
I am not remotely like you.
Course you are. You’re a control freak. You’re a planner. Nothing wrong with that. Me too. First principles... Assume everyone else is an idiot.
I think I have a higher regard for my companions.

But you can’t rely on anyone else to get the job done. Take that hypership of mine. Made for a quick getaway. But like I said, I don’t trust easily. So just in case it wasn’t me getting away... I gave myself remote control.
You mean...?
(FX: FLICKING SWITCHES) Now we’re in range, I can switch the engines off. From here.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 67
SCENE 31: INT. HYPERSHIP (WEAPON STORE)
FX: IN FLIGHT
So you’re a thief. And Garundel’s a conman. You’re both... thieves and conmen. Con... women.
Con artist, babe.
Art? Where’s the art in lying to people to get what you want?

Just gotta be a big enough lie I guess. We were gonna make a fortune. All the weapons. The strongbox with the takings from our cash buyers. Not to mention the credit account where everyone paid their deposits. Only... I was never good at sharing. I’ve a fake I.D. I’ve Garundel’s signature down pat. If I can reach a branch of Galactic Creditbank before he does, I can make a withdrawal. A big withdrawal.
So it’s all about money. I’d rather hoped aliens might have a different set of priorities.

Aw. Bless you and your noble little ideals. Look. I‘m not out to hurt anyone. We’re nearly at Sirius Nine. It’s an A-rated exchange-world. I’1l nip to the bank, then I’1l let you go. If you like, you can take this Schalk fella with you.
And the Doctor’s transport, of course.
(NO-NONSENSE) You’re cute. But no-one’s that cute. A girl can be too generous...
How do you know Garundel won’t get to.. Sirius Nine first?
Because this ship is the fastest thing in the twelve systems, and I can fly it like- (FX: ENGINES DIE) Oh.
That didn’t sound good.
(FX: FLICKING DEAD SWITCHES) It’s not.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 68
SCENE 32: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL — BRIDGE
FX: ENGINES, CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE
Maintain fire, Sergeant. Almost complete.
FX: BLAST OF EXTERNAL LASER CANNON
Incoming missiles.
FX: SONTARAN SHIP ROCKED BY EXPLOSION
Hull integrity at 60 per cent, sir.
What do you think you’re doing? We’re about to be blown to pieces. Shouldn’t your people be firing at their ships? What’s the point of wasting your energy on that moon!
You say you are not military. Yet you cast yourself as a general! You know nothing, Terran.
FX: HUGE EXTERNAL EXPLOSION, AS MOON SHATTERS
There! The moon is destroyed! Major Vlaar! Lead the spheres through the debris.
What are they doing?
The Krellorships are big and clumsy. And now they are blind as well. Their sensors see only the rubble from the moon. Boulders and rocks.
Your spheres — they’re practically the same shape. And size!
And now we know their weakness. See. They turn from the flotsam. The sensor panels on the port bows. Those are the Krellorans’ weak point!
(MARVELLING) Disguise your own ships while exposing your opponent’s Achilles’ heel. Remarkable. You do know what you’re doing after all...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 69
The Vanoonian gambit. Now you have learned something, Terran. (BEAT) Klineforth. If that is your name.
It’s Klein. Dr Elizabeth Klein.
Well, Dr Elizabeth Klein. Watch and envy our prowess. See how the Sontaran Empire wages war!
FX: EXTERNAL LASERS AND EXPLOSIONS, SPACE BATTLE CONTINUES
Marshal. We have contact. Major Vlaar.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page
SCENE 33: INT. SONTARAN SPHERE
FX: WHINE OF ENGINES, CONFINED SPACE
I have the command ship in my sights!
(D) Die well, Major Vlaar.
(D) What’s he doing?!
(D) For the glory of Sontar.
(BATTLE-CRY) Sontar! Sontar! I die for Sontar!
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 71
SCENE 34: INT. KRELLOR SHIP
(FX: ENGINE HUM, INTERNAL EXPLOSIONS, ALARMS, PANICKING
What is happening? We cannot be defeated by these Sontaran scum!
Krakenmother... Weapons cannot lock. Weapons are disabled. They have targeted our sensor arrays...
How can six spheres and a command ship take down a fleet of forty Krellor Battleships? How can they do this?
Because they are... Sontarans...
FX: EXPLOSION AS VLAAR HITS
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 72
SCENE 35: INT. HYPERSHIP (WEAPON STORE)
FX: DEAD SHIP
I spy with my little eye.. Something beginning with H.
You do have an unfair advantage. I don’t know what most of these things are. Besides. There must be something more useful we could do. To get moving again.
Stop changing the subject. You lost. H is for Human! Your turn.
Look, um, I hope you don’t mind me asking, but... what are you? You’re not human, I mean.
What gave it away? Don’t tell me. The hair? Or was it the blue skin and antennae? I’m Gadalaxian. (SAUCY) Most of the rest is the same. Never know. You might find out.
Sorry, but if a girl kidnaps me, Gadalaxian or not, she doesn’t tend to get a second date.
Who are you kidding, tiger? Doesn’t strike me you get that many first dates.
(STAMMERING) Wh- wh- what makes you think that?
No offence, ‘Will-valar’. But I’d bet you’ve met more aliens than girls.

The name’s Arrowsmith. Will Arrowsmith. (BEAT) And I don’t get that much free time... Actually I’ve met twenty-three distinct alien species. In the line of my field work with a top secret military intelligence agency.
Shuuut uuup! You? You’re a soldier?
Yes. Well. No. Not exactly. Scientific advisor. (BEAT) Scientific advisor’s assistant. (BEAT) Probationary.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 73
I knew you wasn’t a soldier. On account of you holding your gun at the wrong end.
Yes. Well. That was supposed to be a disguise.
So. I’m not the only one who tells lies for a living.
BEAT OF SILENCE
Do you.. want to have another go at the starter cylinders? I think I’ve worked out how they fire the engine arrays.
And I’m dead impressed that you did, babe... but no. The override’s automatic. We’d need to stop the signal at source. Which since we can’t move... is totes impossible.
I think I understand. Even if we got the engines started again. The override signal would just cut them out.
You are paying attention, aincha? Yeah. Best sit it out. We’re near the space lanes. There’s plenty of air. We’ll get a lift to port eventually. Look. Long range scanner says someone’s on their way.
Aren’t you worried it might be your boss?
Nah. His bucket of bolts couldn’t make it this far this quick. Most likely a mini-freighter. Cargo for Sirius. I’1l flutter my antennae. Get us a tow.
I must say. You’re being very philosophical about the whole thing.
Some you win.. Some you lose. There’s always another sucker...
BEAT OF SILENCE
You could... come along with us, you know.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 74
Who’s asking who on a date now?
Why not consider it?
Quite some brain on you, Will Arrowsmith. Sure you wouldn’t want to come with me?
I just want to get Schalk to the Doctor. That’s all I can think of for now.
If he even is Schalk.
What? (BEAT) Yes... Of course. You mentioned it before. You said he was fake.
Yeah. We got Kurt Schalk’s DNA profile in the brochure. But... I scraped a sample when I was prepping the vid. And... nope. Doesn’t even match.
Hold on... If Kurt Schalk’s not in that cage... Who is?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 75
SCENE 36: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: ENGINES, CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE
Ah. The glorious sight of an enemy defeated. The bodies. Twisting in space. I’d like to stay longer. Watch their death throes. But no. The mission calls us away.
It’s.. unbelievable. You managed to win. Against that. Against all of that.
You are impressed, Terran? Dr... Klein?
Impressed isn’t the word... Stunned. And your Major Vlaar. He sacrificed himself. I thought you said Sontarans had no word for suicide.
His was a glorious death. Well-earned through our campaigns. He was nine years old. A good lifespan for a warrior.
Tell me about your armies. The Krelloran called you clones.
You do not know of Sontarans?
Only... a little. Imagine I don’t.

The army of Sontar is infinite. Billions upon billions of clones hatch each dawn on the brood-worlds. Wave upon wave of dedicated soldiers. All like Vlaar. All willing to give their life. In the service of their command.
Incredible. What couldn’t be achieved with unlimited troops...?
That is our strength. Every soldier is expendable. And every soldier has but one thought. The glory of the Sontaran Empire. (BEAT) You are silent, Dr Klein?
I was thinking. There’ve been conflicts throughout my world’s history, so many battles, where force of numbers would have swayed the balance.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 76
You know the art of war? I did not think Terra had progressed above level C civilisation.
Oh, we may not have the technology, but humanity’s no slouch when it comes to war, Marshal. I’d say we’re beyond the nursery now. Way beyond.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 77
SCENE 37: INT. GARUNDEL’S PODCRAFT
FX: PODCRAFT IN SPEEDY FLIGHT
No no no no no. None of your Time Lordy mind-games with me, Doctor.
I’m simply asking which is your stronger impulse, Garundel? What motivates you more? Your desire for profit? Or your instinct for self-preservation?
Trick question. No fair.
That Persuasion Machine is not some parlour trick for duping your customers. Any number of alien powers would happily vaporise you to get their paws, claws and assorted tentacles on oe
That’s what I’m banking on.
You’ve really no concern for the fate of anything beyond your own pockets?
Don’t knock it. These are some swanky pockets. The jacket’s from Sirius Five. Like it? I’ve eight more back there. Only you won’t need one. On account of being dead.
You need my help.
Hey. I’m not stupid. I’m making one last score then out. Besides, Persuasion-lite doesn’t really do what your alien powers want it to.
But you have its inventor. I’m surprised you haven’t used him to perfect it already.
Don’t think I didn’t try... But he kept his secrets. However far I dug.
What do you mean?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 78
Schalk pleaded ignorance. So I knocked him out and tried the direct approach. Deep-dive brain-probes.
That’s inhuman.
Thanks. But he didn’t feel a thing. Or if he did, he’1ll never remember...
But you found nothing.
FX: GARUNDEL OPERATES A DATA TABLET

The contents of his mind. All on this data tablet. Here. (HANDS IT TO DOCTOR) Take a look. Nothing... Nothing beyond the blueprints I already had. The rudimentary ideas... but not the finished article. And as for those dreams...
(FX: DOCTOR OPERATES DATA TABLET) Let me see...
Knock yourself out. If you soup up Persuasion-lite like you did
my engines, then maybe you’1ll live to see your next life, Doc.
FX: SHIPS ENGINES ZOOMING OFF
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 79
SCENE 38: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: ENGINES, CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE
Report, Sergeant.
Target stationary, Marshal. We’ve reached the Sirius system.
Good. A true Sontaran never lets his cannons cool.
This mission of yours. Is that why you were at the arms sale?
I do not share my plans with aliens. However... amusing you may be.
Subterfuge isn’t your style. When you saved me from Benarra, you said I didn’t know I was in a fight. Wasn’t that the case for Garundel when you attacked his dome?
I announced our presence. I made our intent clear. Admittedly, these are not the usual form of orders...
But you obeyed them anyway?
(ANNOYED) I follow my orders because I respect the chain of command.
Ah. The soldier’s mantra the galaxy over.
The Generals of High Command are where they are because of past glories. Past victories. They do what is best for Sontar.
Of course. It’s all someone else’s responsibility, isn’t it?
I do not wish to hear your opinions, Dr Klein. Only your history. Tell me more of this Kaiser Wilhelm.
FX: HONKING PROXIMITY ALARM
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 80
Marshal. We have contact.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 81
SCENE 39: INT. HYPERSHIP (WEAPON STORE)
FX: DEAD HYPERSHIP, FOOTSTEPS, ZIV KNOCKS ON TARDIS DOOR
So. This big blue box. What’s the story?
It’s the Doctor’s. His Ship. I mean... I call it a Ship, but it’s so much more. It’s amazing. I’ve barely scratched the surface...

Boys and their toys eh? (WALKING ROUND TARDIS) Looks like a cupboard. Basic transmat device. Seen ‘em before. Usually fetch a few thousand, depending on range. Never this colour. Or with these markings... What’s that say..? ‘Police?’
Oh it’s so much more than a transmat. The interior exists in 4a... another dimension.
Say what?
It’s.. dimensionally transcendental.
Oh. Now I’m interested. That’s gonna add a few zeroes to the price.
(FX: RATTLING TARDIS DOORS) Locked. OK. Let us in then.
I.. don’t have a key. The Doctor does.
Hmmm. Say we could get in. Tell me... This TARDIS of yours... What can it do?
Go absolutely anywhere in time and space.
Wow. (BEAT) I always did want to travel. Meet new people.
I’m actually from Earth. I was born in the twentieth century.
Get away! (LAUGHS) Dunno if that makes you the sugar daddy or me the cradle snatcher... Twentieth Century Earth...?
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 82

Somehow I don’t think he’d want little old me tagging along. No. I know where I belong. I’m used to working with the likes of Garundel. Going along with them. Then stinging them for as much as I can when the time’s right. Cos that way, nobody gets hurt. Nobody who matters anyway.
You must reach a point when you’ve earned enough...

You’d think so, wouldn’t you? But there’s always a slinkier jumpsuit, always more sequins... Always a new coiffure artiste to try. I’ve stayed in every ten-star orbital hotel in the twelve systems. Room-service and Gadalaxian champagne. You should try it some time.
I think you’ve just got used to the lifestyle.
It’s not all about me.. I send credits home. You might not believe it, but I’m looking after my old Auntie back on Gadalax Major. Not got long left now... But I’ll see to it she goes out in style.
I see. So, you’re like... Robin Hood?

Robin who? (BEAT) Why settle for daylight robbery, Auntie Vezza always says, if you can get away with starlight robbery? (BEAT) Nah, I dunno what it means either. Talks a load of old nonsense, Auntie Vezza.
Come with us, Ziv. You never know what might happen.
FX: ENGINES START
Uh-oh. We’re back online. Look.
FX: SCANNER OPENS, RADAR BLIP
It’s another ship. We’re saved. (BEAT)
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 83
(AT CONTROLS) How did he...?

It’s Garundel. And I don’t think he’s here to give me a promotion...
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 84
SCENE 40: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: ENGINES, CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE
Intercept course, Marshal.
I’ve a question, Stenn. Don’t worry. It’s not about your precious orders.
You may ask it. Once you answer mine.
Go on.
Why were you at the arms sale?
For Schalk. We were only interested in Dr Kurt Schalk.
Of course. You come to claim your own. Your kinsman. Go ahead. Your question.
Why am I still alive?
You have seen already, Dr Klein. I do nothing without strategic purpose. Therefore there is a reason.
So what am I? A hostage? A bargaining chip? I should tell you now — I’ve nothing to do with this Garundel. The people who took your weapons.
If I’d had reason for you to know, then I would have told you. My own question has just provided an answer. If you have not worked it out, I need not tell you.
What are you talking about? (SOTTO) You’re worse than the Doctor.
Be silent now.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 85
Hypership in range, sir. The vessel is shielded. Lifesigns... unreadable.
Open a channel, Sergeant.
Aye sir.
FX: PROXIMITY ALARM
Marshal... There is... another craft approaching.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 86
SCENE 41: INT. GARUNDEL’S PODCRAFT
FX: GLOOPY ENGINES, GARUNDEL WORKING CONTROLS
Gotcha. Come to momma. My little hypership.
Remote control...
Told ya. I thought of everything. So what’s the verdict on Schalk’s brain?
You were right. Nothing useful in this data tablet. (SOTTO) Not to you...
In that case, I think this beautiful friendship has run its course.
I can’t say I’m disappointed.
Oh but you should be. It’s gonna be a very short reunion for you and the boy blunder. We’re getting my loot back. I’m taking your TARDIS. Then I’m killing you both. But maybe not in that order.
An admirably succinct plan. But you might not get the chance to carry it out. We are not alone.
FX: ALARMS
Proximity alarm...
Check your starboard scanners, Garundel. Sontarans.
(D) Attention. All aliens. This is Marshal Stenn of the Six- Twentieth Sontaran Attack Fleet. Hold your positions.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 87
SCENE 42: INT. SONTARAN COMMAND VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: CLUNKY SONTARAN SHIP AMBIENCE

(ALOUD TO COMM) Repeat. Do not move. The hypership is claimed by the Sontaran Empire. It contains property of an Imperial Attack Fleet. As such it is now a legitimate asset of that fleet. Any attempt to interfere with military business will be deemed an act of aggression against the Sontaran Empire and dealt with accordingly.
(VIA COMMS) Marshal Stenn. Old buddy. Surely we can come to some arrangement. There’s my property in there too.
(VIA COMMS) Listen to me, Stenn. This situation has ramifications far beyond your petty war. I demand that all non- combatants be allowed to leave the vessel first.
(CALLING) Doctor! Is that you? Will’s on that other ship!
(D) Elizabeth! You’re alive! Yes, I know.
The... Doctor? The.. Time Lord known as the Doctor?
Scans confirm Gallifreyan occupant in podcraft.
(D) Please, explain to the Marshal we need to-
FX: COMMS CUT OFF
Aren’t you even going to listen?
I have already stated my intent. They have not complied.
That’s it? Shoot first and ask questions later?
It is a most efficient policy. One can usually dispense with the questions that way. Gredd — target the Urodelian podcraft.
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 88
But... the Doctor’s in there!
I remind you, Dr Klein. You are a prisoner of the Sontaran Empire. One more word and I shall remove your tongue. (TO GREDD) Take aim, Sergeant.
Podcraft in range. Missile ready.
This will be a Grag-diamond shot. (BEAT) You may ask the question Dr Klein.
(STEELY) What is a Grag-diamond shot?

The Grag-diamond is a jewel adorning the standard of the First Sontaran Legion. A double-compressed diamond from the mines of Sontar. A stone within a stone. Two targets hit with a single shot. Eradication of enemies old and new. The treacherous Urodelian and the infamous Doctor himself. With one Meson torpedo. Fire!
No, you mustn’t!
FX: MISSILE STREAKS AWAY...
First the victory against Krellor and now this. Today... is a
very good day indeed. But not for the Doctor.
FX: MISSILE HITS. EXPLOSION
END OF PART THREE
STARLIGHT ROBBERY (FINAL) Page 89
